questions.question: What is the primary purpose of an IP address?
choices: To uniquely identify devices on a network
questions.answer: To uniquely identify devices on a network

questions.question: How many bits are in an IPv4 address?
questions.answer: 32 bits

questions.question: Which of the following is a valid IPv4 address?
What is the primary reason for the development of IPv6?
questions.answer: To address IPv4 address exhaustion

questions.question: How many bits are in an IPv6 address?
questions.answer: 128 bits

questions.question: Which notation is used to represent IPv6 addresses?
questions.answer: Hexadecimal

questions.question: What is the range of the first octet in a Class A IPv4 address?
What is the default subnet mask for a Class B network?
Which IP address class is reserved for multicast addresses?
questions.answer: Class D

questions.question: What does CIDR stand for?
questions.answer: Classless Inter-Domain Routing

questions.question: In CIDR notation, what does the '/24' in '192.168.1.0/24' represent?
choices: The number of available host addresses
The number of bits in the network portion of the address
The class of the IP address
questions.answer: The number of bits in the network portion of the address

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of subnetting?
choices: To increase the total number of available IP addresses
To divide large networks into smaller, more manageable subnetworks
questions.answer: To divide large networks into smaller, more manageable subnetworks

questions.question: Which part of an IP address does subnetting affect?
choices: Both the network and host portions
Neither the network nor the host portion
questions.answer: Both the network and host portions

questions.question: What is the subnet mask for a /28 CIDR network?
How many usable host addresses are available in a /30 subnet?
Which of the following is a private IP address range?
questions.answer: All of the above

questions.question: What is the purpose of a subnet mask?
choices: To determine which portion of an IP address refers to the network and which to the host
questions.answer: To determine which portion of an IP address refers to the network and which to the host

questions.question: In IPv6, what is the equivalent of the IPv4 address 127.0.0.1?
What is the maximum number of hosts in a /23 network?
Which of the following is NOT a benefit of subnetting?
choices: More efficient use of IP addresses
Increased total number of available IP addresses
questions.answer: Increased total number of available IP addresses

questions.question: What is the network address of the subnet that includes the IP address 192.168.5.130/26?
Which of the following is true about the loopback address in IPv4?
choices: It is used to test the network interface
It is not routable on the internet
questions.answer: All of the above

questions.question: What is the broadcast address for the network 172.16.20.0/23?
Which of the following is NOT a valid IPv6 address representation?
What is the primary advantage of CIDR over classful addressing?
choices: It allows for more flexible allocation of IP addresses
It increases the total number of available IP addresses
questions.answer: It allows for more flexible allocation of IP addresses

questions.question: Which of the following is true about the relationship between subnet masks and CIDR notation?
choices: CIDR notation replaces subnet masks entirely
CIDR notation is a more compact way to represent subnet masks
Subnet masks can only be represented in dotted decimal notation
questions.answer: CIDR notation is a more compact way to represent subnet masks

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Network Address Translation (NAT) in relation to IP addressing?
choices: To allow multiple devices to share a single public IP address
questions.answer: To allow multiple devices to share a single public IP address

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a Class C IP address?
choices: The first octet is between 192 and 223
It has a default subnet mask of 255.255.0.0
It is commonly used for large networks
It allows for more than 16 million host addresses
questions.answer: The first octet is between 192 and 223

questions.question: What is the primary difference between public and private IP addresses?
choices: Public IP addresses are faster than private IP addresses
Private IP addresses are routable on the internet, while public IP addresses are not
Public IP addresses are globally unique, while private IP addresses can be reused in different networks
Private IP addresses use IPv6, while public IP addresses use IPv4
questions.answer: Public IP addresses are globally unique, while private IP addresses can be reused in different networks

questions.question: In the context of IP addressing, what does APIPA stand for?
choices: Advanced Protocol for Internet Protocol Addressing
Address Protocol for Internet Protocol Authentication
questions.answer: Automatic Private IP Addressing
